text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Romania will soon hold tenders for upgrading the Bucharest-Pitesti motorway.
ADEVARUL

- National Peasant Party secretary-general Radu Vasile says electoral promises of higher child benefits and pensions should be respected despite recommendations from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to postpone the increases.
- Prices of farm machinery are expected to rise by 40 percent starting January.
- Year-on-year inflation quickened to 47.4 percent in November, according to the National Statistics Board.
- IMF-proposed emergency measures to root out the causes behind rising inflation include increases in energy and fuel prices.
TINERETUL LIBER
- The national organissation of employers and entrepreneurs has pledged to support the new government and its policy to relaunch the economy.
AZI
- Labour Minister Alexandru Athanasiu said child benefits would be increased in four months' time.
ZIUA
- The price of petrol will not rise before January.
LIBERTATEA
- The Private Ownership Fund "Muntenia", recently turned into an investment company, will start distributing shareholders' certificates under the mass selloff scheme in January.
CRONICA ROMANA
- The government promises to pay the 13th-month wage for state employees before January 10.
- Monthly inflation stood at 5.8 percent in November.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Communications Minister Sorin Pantis said he was considering plans to privatise the state-run telephone company Rom Telecom RA.
- Steel smelter Sidex SA plans to launch bonds worth $100 million in the international market.
General:
All newspapers report on celebrations in the western city of Timisoara marking seven years after the December 1989 revolution.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Film director Stere Gulea was apointed new manager of the state television.
- The National Peasant Party, backbone of the Democratic Convention (CDR) which won the November elections, seeks the chairmanship of Romania's delegations to NATO and the Council of Europe.
- The upper house, the Senate, decided to call an extraordinary parliamentary session starting mid-January, said Senate speaker Petre Roman.
ADEVARUL
- Romania will have New Year public holidays from December 30 to January 6.
- Vasile Lupu, vice-president of the lower Chamber of Deputies, will meet new justice minister Valeriu Stoica and ask for the former Securitate secret police files to be opened.
- Health Minister Stefan Dragulescu said that more than 60 percent of Romanians live below the poverty threshold.
- Three percent of Romania's children are begging or working as prostitutes, said a UNICEF report.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- The Social Democratic Union (USD) will ask for 20 posts of state secretaries in the new coalition cabinet.
- The construction of a racecourse near Bucharest estimated to cost some $25 million will start next year.
- The newspaper publishes the indictment drawn up by the prosecution charging Corneliu Vadim Tudor, head of the Greater Romania Party, with libel.
- The Bucharest prosecution arrested eight people alleged members of a gang of traffickers of radioactive materials.
CRONICA ROMANA
- The newspaper publishes an interview with the new Transport Minister Traian Basescu on the state of the sector.
DIMINEATA
- The December 1989 revolution was a popular and national revolt, says a statement by the former ruling Party of Social Democracy.
AZI
- The newspaper publishes an interview with Justice Minister Stoica, who says he will ask the civil code to be changed. ($=3,769 lei) -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
